Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.basic.interfaces

Interface ProgressIndicator

All Known Implementing Classes:
JStateString
public interface ProgressIndicator

This interface can be used for indicating long time processing progress in applications. Indicating process can be single-stage and multistage. Single-stage life cycle for the interface is:

  • calling start(String, long) method
  • calling processed(long) method repeatedly.
  • calling end() method.

MultiState life cycle for the interface is:

  • calling start(String) method
  • calling stage(String,int,int) or stage(String,int,int,long) method
  • calling processed(long) method repeatedly.
  • calling endStage() method.
  • repeat three previous steps if needed
  • calling end() method.
Since:
0.0.3
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void end()
    End progress
    default int endStage()
    Ends the current stage
    boolean processed​(long processed)
    Process the next piece of data.
    default void stage​(java.lang.String caption, int stage, int of)
    Start new stage of multistage progress.
    default void stage​(java.lang.String caption, int stage, int of, long total)
    Start new stage of multistage progress.
    void start​(java.lang.String caption)
    Start multistage progress.
    void start​(java.lang.String caption, long total)
    Start single-stage progress.

  • Method Details

    • start

      void start​(java.lang.String caption, long total)

      Start single-stage progress.

      Parameters:
      caption - caption to display. Can't be null or empty. Always is not localized. You can use it as a key to get localized string
      total - total data to process. If unknown, -1 will be typed.

    • start

      void start​(java.lang.String caption)

      Start multistage progress.

      Parameters:
      caption - caption to display. Can't be null or empty. Always is not localized. You can use it as a key to get localized string

    • stage

      default void stage​(java.lang.String caption, int stage, int of)

      Start new stage of multistage progress.

      Parameters:
      caption - caption to display. Can't be null or empty. Always is not localized. You can use it as a key to get localized string
      stage - stage number. Always positive
      of - total number of stages. Always positive. It's not guaranteed to be the same during all life cycle

    • stage

      default void stage​(java.lang.String caption, int stage, int of, long total)

      Start new stage of multistage progress.

      Parameters:
      caption - caption to display. Can't be null or empty. Always is not localized. You can use it as a key to get localized string
      stage - stage number. Always positive
      of - total number of stages. Always positive. It's not guaranteed to be the same during all life cycle
      total - total data to process

    • processed

      boolean processed​(long processed)

      Process the next piece of data.

      Parameters:
      processed - piece size already processed. Always must be treated as absolute value from the beginning, not incremental. If piece amount of the work can't be defined, can be zero
      Returns:
      true - continue processing, false - interrupt long progress

    • endStage

      default int endStage()

      Ends the current stage

      Returns:
      -1 - continue processing, 0 - interrupt long progress, any positive - ultimate branch to the given stage of the processing

    • end

      void end()

      End progress
